name: Muhammad
hints: He was a religious leader born in Mecca around 570 CE.
He is considered the last prophet in Islam.
He received revelations that became the Quran.
He united much of the Arabian Peninsula under Islam.
His migration to Medina is known as the Hijra.

name: Isaac Newton
hints: He developed the laws of motion and universal gravitation.
He invented calculus independently around the same time as Leibniz.
He published 'Principia Mathematica' in 1687.
He made significant contributions to optics and the study of light.
He was a key figure in the Scientific Revolution.

name: Jesus Christ
hints: He is central to Christianity.
He was born in Bethlehem according to Christian tradition.
He taught parables about love, forgiveness, and faith.
He was crucified under Pontius Pilate.
Christians believe he was resurrected three days after his death.

name: Buddha (Siddhartha Gautama)
hints: He was born a prince in ancient India.
He renounced his wealth to seek enlightenment.
He attained enlightenment under the Bodhi tree.
He taught the Four Noble Truths.
He founded Buddhism and introduced the Eightfold Path.

name: Confucius
hints: He was a Chinese philosopher during the Spring and Autumn period.
His teachings emphasize ethics and social harmony.
He advocated respect for elders and family loyalty.
His ideas were recorded in the Analects.
He greatly influenced East Asian culture and governance.

name: Paul the Apostle
hints: He was originally named Saul and was a Roman citizen.
He converted to Christianity after a vision of Jesus.
He traveled extensively to spread Christianity.
He wrote many letters in the New Testament.
He is considered one of the most influential Christian missionaries.

name: Cai Lun
hints: He lived during the Han Dynasty in ancient China.
He is credited with inventing paper around 105 CE.
His invention revolutionized writing and record-keeping.
His paper-making process used tree bark and old rags.
He is honored as a significant figure in Chinese history.

name: Johannes Gutenberg
hints: He invented the printing press with movable type.
His invention was completed in the 15th century.
The Gutenberg Bible was the first major book printed.
His invention greatly advanced the spread of knowledge.
He is often called the father of modern printing.

name: Christopher Columbus
hints: He was an Italian explorer sponsored by Spain.
He made four voyages across the Atlantic Ocean.
He is credited with opening the Americas to European colonization.
He mistakenly thought he had reached Asia.
His first voyage was in 1492.

name: Albert Einstein
hints: He developed the theory of relativity.
He introduced the famous equation E=mc^2.
He won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.
His work influenced the development of quantum mechanics.
He left Germany in 1933 to escape Nazi persecution.

name: Louis Pasteur
hints: He developed the process of pasteurization.
He made significant discoveries in microbiology.
He laid the foundations for germ theory.
He developed vaccines for rabies and anthrax.
He is often called the father of modern medicine.

name: Galileo Galilei
hints: He improved the telescope for astronomical observation.
He discovered the moons of Jupiter.
He supported the heliocentric model of the solar system.
He was tried by the Inquisition for his beliefs.
He is known as the father of modern observational astronomy.

name: Aristotle
hints: He was a student of Plato and teacher of Alexander the Great.
He wrote extensively on various fields, including biology and ethics.
He is considered one of the greatest philosophers in Western history.
He classified organisms in his works on biology.
His works influenced medieval scholarship and beyond.

name: Euclid
hints: He is known as the 'Father of Geometry.'
He wrote 'Elements,' a foundational mathematical text.
His work greatly influenced mathematics for over 2,000 years.
He lived in Alexandria, Egypt, during the Hellenistic period.
He organized mathematical knowledge into axioms and theorems.

name: Moses
hints: He is a prophet in Judaism, Christianity, and Islam.
He led the Israelites out of slavery in Egypt.
He received the Ten Commandments on Mount Sinai.
He is a central figure in the Exodus narrative.
He is traditionally credited with writing the Torah.

name: Charles Darwin
hints: He formulated the theory of evolution by natural selection.
He published 'On the Origin of Species' in 1859.
His observations were based on his voyage on the HMS Beagle.
He studied finches on the Gal√°pagos Islands.
His work transformed the field of biology.

name: Napoleon Bonaparte
hints: He was a French military leader during the Revolution.
He crowned himself Emperor of the French.
He implemented the Napoleonic Code.
He expanded his empire across much of Europe.
He was exiled twice, to Elba and Saint Helena.

name: Alexander the Great
hints: He was the King of Macedon in ancient Greece.
He conquered the Persian Empire.
He founded many cities, including Alexandria in Egypt.
He spread Greek culture throughout his empire.
He is considered one of history's greatest military commanders.

name: Thomas Edison
hints: He held over 1,000 patents for his inventions.
He developed the phonograph and the light bulb.
He created the first industrial research lab.
His work laid the foundation for the electric power industry.
He was nicknamed the 'Wizard of Menlo Park.'

name: James Watt
hints: He improved the design of the steam engine.
His work helped drive the Industrial Revolution.
The unit of power 'watt' is named after him.
He worked on improving engine efficiency.
He was a Scottish inventor and mechanical engineer.

name: Constantine the Great
hints: He was the first Roman emperor to convert to Christianity.
He issued the Edict of Milan, granting religious tolerance.
He founded the city of Constantinople.
He played a key role in the Council of Nicaea.
He ended persecution of Christians in the Roman Empire.

name: George Washington
hints: He was the first President of the United States.
He led the Continental Army to victory in the American Revolution.
He presided over the Constitutional Convention in 1787.
He set the precedent of serving only two terms as President.
He is often called the 'Father of His Country.'

name: Karl Marx
hints: He co-authored 'The Communist Manifesto' with Friedrich Engels.
He developed the theory of historical materialism.
His work laid the foundation for Marxism.
He wrote 'Das Kapital,' analyzing capitalism.
His ideas influenced socialist and communist movements worldwide.

name: Orville and Wilbur Wright
hints: They were pioneers in aviation.
They made the first successful powered flight in 1903.
Their aircraft was named the Wright Flyer.
They were self-taught engineers and inventors.
Their work revolutionized transportation worldwide.

name: Genghis Khan
hints: He was the founder of the Mongol Empire.
He united the Mongol tribes into a powerful army.
His empire became the largest contiguous empire in history.
He promoted trade and cultural exchange along the Silk Road.
He was known for his military genius and conquests.

name: Adam Smith
hints: He is known as the father of modern economics.
He wrote 'The Wealth of Nations' in 1776.
He introduced the concept of the 'invisible hand.'
His work laid the foundation for free-market economics.
He emphasized the importance of division of labor.

name: William Shakespeare
hints: He was an English playwright and poet.
His works include 'Hamlet,' 'Macbeth,' and 'Romeo and Juliet.'
He is often called the 'Bard of Avon.'
He wrote 154 sonnets and 39 plays.
His works have been translated into every major language.

name: John Dalton
hints: He developed the atomic theory of matter.
He researched color blindness, sometimes called Daltonism.
He made significant contributions to meteorology.
He identified chemical compounds as combinations of atoms.
His atomic theory revolutionized chemistry.

name: Alexander Fleming
hints: He discovered penicillin in 1928.
His discovery revolutionized the treatment of bacterial infections.
He won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1945.
His work laid the foundation for modern antibiotics.
He made his discovery accidentally while working with mold.

name: Antoine Lavoisier
hints: He is known as the 'Father of Modern Chemistry.'
He discovered the role of oxygen in combustion.
He helped develop the metric system.
He identified and named hydrogen and oxygen.
He was executed during the French Revolution.

name: Sigmund Freud
hints: He is the father of psychoanalysis.
He introduced the concept of the unconscious mind.
He developed therapeutic techniques like dream analysis.
He proposed the id, ego, and superego model of the mind.
His work influenced psychology and popular culture.

name: Plato
hints: He was a student of Socrates and teacher of Aristotle.
He founded the Academy in Athens.
He wrote philosophical dialogues like 'The Republic.'
He introduced the concept of ideal forms or ideas.
His works laid the foundation for Western philosophy.

name: Alexander Graham Bell
hints: He invented the telephone in 1876.
He founded the Bell Telephone Company.
He was also a teacher for the deaf.
His invention revolutionized communication worldwide.
He continued to work on inventions in aeronautics and hydrofoils.

name: Vladimir Lenin
hints: He was the leader of the Bolshevik Revolution in Russia.
He became the first head of the Soviet state.
He developed the political theory of Leninism.
He played a key role in the Russian Civil War.
He advocated for proletarian revolution and socialism.

name: Martin Luther
hints: He was a German monk and theologian.
He nailed his Ninety-Five Theses to a church door in 1517.
He sparked the Protestant Reformation.
He translated the Bible into German.
He emphasized salvation through faith alone.

name: Nicolas Copernicus
hints: He developed the heliocentric model of the universe.
His model placed the Sun at the center, not the Earth.
His work challenged traditional Ptolemaic astronomy.
He published 'On the Revolutions of the Celestial Spheres.'
His ideas laid the foundation for modern astronomy.

name: James Clerk Maxwell
hints: He developed the theory of electromagnetism.
His equations describe electric and magnetic fields.
He made significant contributions to the study of light.
His work paved the way for quantum theory.
He is considered one of the greatest physicists in history.

name: Leonardo da Vinci
hints: He was a Renaissance polymath and artist.
He painted 'Mona Lisa' and 'The Last Supper.'
He made contributions to anatomy and engineering.
He sketched designs for flying machines and other inventions.
He is considered one of history's greatest geniuses.

name: Thomas Jefferson
hints: He was the third President of the United States.
He authored the Declaration of Independence.
He completed the Louisiana Purchase in 1803.
He founded the University of Virginia.
He was a strong advocate for democracy and individual rights.

name: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
hints: He was a French Enlightenment philosopher.
He wrote 'The Social Contract.'
He emphasized the concept of popular sovereignty.
His ideas influenced the French Revolution.
He believed in the innate goodness of humanity.
